data.value: Skipping previously processed assembly: {0}.

data.name: VersionPropertyWillbeIgnored
data.value: The requiredVersion, minimumVersion or maximumVersion property applies to PowerShell modules. For the assembly providers, it is ignored.

data.value: Importing package provider '{0}'.

data.name: ProviderSuccessfullyLoadedFromLocation
data.value: The provider is loaded from path: '{0}'.

data.name: AssemblyPackageProviderAlreadyLoaded
data.value: Version {0} of the Package Provider {1} is already loaded. Since this is an assembly-based provider, we cannot load another version.

data.name: ProviderNameAndVersionNotAvailableFromFilePath
data.value: The specified assembly '{0}' in \ProviderAssemblies, should be installed in ProviderAssemblies\ProviderName\Version. Either delete the provider assembly from \ProviderAssemblies, or create \ProviderAssemblies\ProvidernName\Version, and then move the assembly there.

data.name: SingleAssemblyAllowed
data.value: Multiple assemblies are found under path '{0}'. Please install a single provider assembly under each version folder.

data.name: NoMatchFoundForCriteria
data.value: No match was found for the specified search criteria and provider name '{0}'. Try 'Get-PackageProvider -ListAvailable' to see if the provider exists on the system.

data.name: InvalidParameter
data.value: Wildcards in the '{0}' is not supported. Please specify a full provider name.

data.name: InstallRequiresCurrentUserScopeParameterForNonAdminUser
data.value: Administrator rights are required to install packages in '{0}'. Log on to the computer with an account that has Administrator rights, and then try again, or install '{1}' by adding "-Scope CurrentUser" to your command. You can also try running the Windows PowerShell session with elevated rights (Run as Administrator).

data.name: InvalidHashFormat
data.value: The format of the specified hash '{0}' is invalid.

data.name: MissingFileTag
data.value: Missing File xml tag.

data.name: MissingHashAttribute
data.value: Missing the hash attribute within the File xml tag.

data.name: MissingHashContent
data.value: The value of the hash xml attribute is empty.

data.name: UnsupportedHashAlgorithm
data.value: The specified hash algorithm '{0}' is not supported. Please try using '{1}' instead.

data.name: ProviderNotResponsive
data.value: Provider '{0}' is not respecting the responsiveness threshold in a timely fashion; Canceling request.

data.value: "Provider '{0}' is not completing the request in the time allowed; Canceling request.

data.name: SwidTagXmlInvalidNameSpace
